meanings.definition: Start again or reset (a computer or electronic device).
meanings.sent1: I had to reboot my computer to fix the problem.
meanings.sent2: Remember to reboot your phone if it's acting slow.
meanings.sent3: After the movie froze, I had to reboot it like a magic spell.
meanings.sent4: Sometimes, a good night's sleep can reboot your mind like a computer.
meanings.sent5: Pressing the reboot button is like giving your device a fresh start.

meanings.definition: Give new energy or strength to (something).
meanings.sent1: A short break can help reboot your focus during work.
meanings.sent2: Exercise can reboot your body and make you feel more energetic.
meanings.sent3: Listening to music can reboot my mood when I'm feeling down.
meanings.sent4: The sunshine seemed to reboot the flowers, making them bloom beautifully.
meanings.sent5: A good laugh can reboot your spirit and make your day brighter.
